summary: Biocatalysis has evolved through three waves, with the third wave focusing on directed evolution techniques that enhance enzyme stability and substrate specificity. This has enabled the production of advanced pharmaceutical intermediates and fine chemicals.
key_claims: Directed evolution techniques have been developed to improve enzyme stability and substrate specificity.
These advancements allow for the production of complex chemical compounds, including pharmaceutical intermediates.
